pageContext.claim: “Tremendous amounts of work was done on trade, not only on the deals -- and we have at least $300 billion worth of deals, but that will be, I think, way triple that number in a fairly short period of time.”
pageContext.analysis: This is not accurate. Many of the arrangements are nonbinding memorandums rather than legal contracts. And despite the claims of success, the trade deficit with China has grown 7 percent from January to October, according to a December report from the Commerce Department.
